One member of each household must comple: One member of each household must complete the Alberta Isolation Questionnaire and submit it at the provincial check point. The Government of Alberta will be contacting all households to ensure compliance with public health measures.
The Government of Alberta has implemente: The Government of Alberta has implemented public health measures to help stop the spread of COVID-19. All travellers arriving from outside Canada are legally required, in accordance with the requirements of Alberta's Chief Medical Officer of Health (CMOH) Orders 05-2020 and 11-2020, to:
Be in quarantine for a minimum of 14 day: Be in quarantine for a minimum of 14 days;
If exhibiting symptoms of COVID 19, whic: If exhibiting symptoms of COVID 19, which are not related to a pre-existing illness or health condition, be in isolation for a minimum of 10 days from the start of symptoms, or until symptoms resolve, whichever is longer.
The Department may collect, use and disc: The Department may collect, use and disclose, in accordance with sections 52.95 to 52.97 and 52.98 of the Public Health Act (PHA), individually identifying health information collected in this isolation questionnaire, without the consent of the traveller(s) whose information may be contained in this isolation questionnaire.
The Department may collect and use indiv: The Department may collect and use individually identifying health information collected in this isolation questionnaire in accordance with section 52.96 of the PHA for the purpose of contacting a traveller to provide information to a traveller about available Government of Alberta resources or other health services, and to collect further information respecting the isolation or quarantine of the traveller or a member of the traveller’s group as required by CMOH Order 05-2020.
In accordance with section 52.98 of the: In accordance with section 52.98 of the PHA the Department may disclose individually identifying health information collected in a traveller’s isolation questionnaire to other departments within the Government of Alberta for the purpose of enabling the departments to provide services to support a traveller in complying with the requirement to isolate or quarantine, as required by CMOH Order 05-2020.
The Department may use or disclose indiv: The Department may use or disclose individually identifying health information collected in a traveller’s isolation questionnaire or collected when a traveller is contacted in pursuant to the Public Health Act for the purposes of issuing a violation ticket under Part 3 of the Provincial Offences Procedure Act.
When completed, the information on this: When completed, the information on this isolation questionnaire is collected, used and disclosed under the authority of the Public Health Act, as amended, and sections 20(b) and 27(1)(a), (b) and (f), 35(1)(p) and 36(a) of the Health Information Act.
Are you sure you want to leave?: Are you sure you want to leave?
You may be asked to present your confirm: You may be asked to present your confirmation below.
Proceed to the provincial check point, i: Proceed to the provincial check point, if available at your location, where you may be asked to confirm how you will comply with the provincial order to self isolate.
First name must be less than 255 charact: First name must be less than 255 characters
Last name must be less than 255 characte: Last name must be less than 255 characters
Date of birth cannot be greater than tod: Date of birth cannot be greater than today
Phone number must be less than 35 charac: Phone number must be less than 35 characters
Must specify if there are additional tra: Must specify if there are additional travellers
Name of airport or border crossing is re: Name of airport or border crossing is required
Arrival city/town must be less than 255: Arrival city/town must be less than 255 characters
City/town must be less than 255 characte: City/town must be less than 255 characters
Must specify if you have a place to stay: Must specify if you have a place to stay
Address must be less than 1024 character: Address must be less than 1024 characters
Postal code must be less than 32 charact: Postal code must be less than 32 characters
Details must be less than 512 characters: Details must be less than 512 characters
Must specify if vulnerable people live w: Must specify if vulnerable people live with you
Must specify if people are residing at t: Must specify if people are residing at that location who are not travelling with you today
Must specify if you are able to make the: Must specify if you are able to make the necessary arrangements
Arrival Date must not be past 5 days: Arrival Date must not be past 5 days
Are you travelling with additional membe: Are you travelling with additional members from your household?*
For each traveller, please list their fi: For each traveller, please list their first name, last name and date of birth
Name of Airport or Border Crossing*: Name of Airport or Border Crossing*
How many cities and countries did you an: How many cities and countries did you and members of your household visit in the last 14 days?
Name of every city and country that you: Name of every city and country that you and members of your household have visited for longer than 12 hours in the last 14 days
Countries listed are taken from the ISO: Countries listed are taken from the ISO 3166 Standard
Quarantine and isolation mean staying ho: Quarantine and isolation mean staying home, not attending work, school, social events or any other public gatherings. You are also prohibited from going outside in your neighborhood and from taking public transportation like buses
When you or members of your household do: When you or members of your household do not have symptoms, you are in quarantine and must watch for symptoms (cough, fever, shortness of breath, runny nose or sore throat).
If you or members of your household deve: If you or members of your household develop COVID or COVID-like symptoms, you must stay in isolation and avoid close contact with people in your household who are ill and those who are well, especially seniors and people with chronic conditions or compromised immune systems.
Do you have a place to stay for the requ: Do you have a place to stay for the required quarantine or isolation period?*
What is the address where you will be qu: What is the address where you will be quarantining or isolating?
What type of a place is it?*: What type of a place is it?*
How will you get to this location?*: How will you get to this location?*
Are there people residing at that locati: Are there people residing at that location who are not travelling with you today?*
Does a vulnerable person also live there: Does a vulnerable person also live there? For example, someone who is over the age of 65 or who has heart disease, high blood pressure, asthma or other lung disease, diabetes, cancer, or underlying health conditions?*
Are you able to make the necessary arran: Are you able to make the necessary arrangements during the applicable quarantine or isolation period for assistance to meet your basic needs? (e.g. food, medication, child care, cleaning supplies, pet care)?*
If you do not have access to the appropr: If you do not have access to the appropriate transportation or accommodations, these may be provided to you
If Other, Please specify the Province/Te: If Other, Please specify the Province/Territory*
